standard_metadata.standard_title: Combining like terms with negative coefficients

question.content: ** Combine the like terms to create an equivalent expression: **    ${-3z-z} = $

hints.content: To **combine like terms**, we find all of the terms with the same variable to the same power. Then we add their [[☃ definition 1]].  That gives us an equivalent expression with fewer terms.  Hint: We can commute, associate, and distribute the terms once we rewrite all subtraction as addition of the opposite.

We rewrite as addition. Then we combine the $\maroonE{z}$ terms:   ${ \begin{align}  -3z-z&=\underbrace{-3z}_{\text{term}}+\underbrace{(-z)}_{\text{term}}\\\\ &= (-3 - 1)\maroonE{z} \\\\ &= -4\maroonE{z} \end{align}} $  [[☃ explanation 1]]

question.content: ** Combine the like terms to create an equivalent expression: **   $-4q+10-(-8q) =$

hints.content: To **combine like terms**, we find all of the terms with the same variable to the same power. Then we add their [[☃ definition 1]].  That gives us an equivalent expression with fewer terms.  Hint: We can commute, associate, and distribute the terms once we rewrite all subtraction as addition of the opposite.

We rewrite as addition. Then we commute and combine the $\maroonD{q}$ terms:   $\begin{align}  -4\maroonD{q} + 10 - (-8\maroonD{q}) &=  \underbrace{-4\maroonD{q}}_{\text{term}} + \underbrace{1}_{\text{term}} + \underbrace{8\maroonD{q}}_{\text{term}}\\\\ &= -4\maroonD{q} + 8\maroonD{q} + 10\\\\ &= (-4 +8)\maroonD{q} + 10\\\\ &= 4\maroonD{q} + 10  \end{align}$

hints.content: To **combine like terms**, we find all of the terms with the same variable to the same power. Then we add their [[☃ definition 1]].  That gives us an equivalent expression with fewer terms.  Hint: We can commute, associate, and distribute the terms because we are adding.

Let's commute and combine the $\maroonD{n}$ terms:  $\begin{align} &\phantom{=}  \underbrace{5\maroonD{n}}_{\text{term}} + \underbrace{6}_{\text{term}} + \underbrace{(-7\maroonD{n})}_{\text{term}}\\\\ &= 5\maroonD{n} + (-7\maroonD{n}) + 6\\\\ &= (5 -7)\maroonD{n} + 6\\\\ &= -2\maroonD{n} + 6  \end{align}$

** Combine the like terms to create an equivalent expression: **   $-4p+(-2)+2p+3 =$

hints.content: To **combine like terms**, we find all of the terms with the same variable to the same power. Then we add their [[☃ definition 1]].  That gives us an equivalent expression with fewer terms.

We can commute and combine the $\maroonD{p}$ terms:   $\begin{align}  -4\maroonD{p} +(- 2) + 2\maroonD{p} + 3 =& -4\maroonD{p} + 2\maroonD{p} +(- 2) + 3 \\\\ =& (-4 + 2)\maroonD{p} +(- 2) + 3 \\\\ &= -2\maroonD{p} - 2 + 3  \end{align}$
Then we combine the numeric terms:   $-2\maroonD{p} +(- \blueE{2}) + \blueE{3} = -2\maroonD{p} + \blueE{1}$
